intro: Elytranthe henryi, commonly known as the Henry's elytranthe, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers and narrow, hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, producing small, pink to purple flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
